ovdesc.p: This table stores the relationship between the National Clearing Code (NCC) and the BIC. This table would be used to convert a National ID to its corresponding BIC or vice versa.
Data for this table can be keyed in manually or can be uploaded from a file
Any manually keyedin record in the Bank code table is marked as manually updated.
The upload process does not overwrite records keyed in manually.

desc.p: Name of the financial institution or bank
Contains the BIC-11 issued together with the IBANs for the institution’s clients.
Branch code (3 characters – XXX to denote head or main office)
Country code in the IBAN. This follows ISO 3166-1, contains only alphabets and is 2 character long.
Under certain circumstances this can be different from the country indicated in field Country Name
The National ID which is as part of the IBAN.
A maximum of 15 characters may be entered.
The National identifier of the institution/branch otherwise called NCC(National Clearing Code)
Used for internal purpose.Holds the ID of the current live record of store table PPT.BANKCODE. This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters.
The source from which details of bank code was updated. This is a free text field

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to, during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.
Specifies whether this specific record can be overwritten when uploaded from a file.
To prevent data upload to overwrite this record, set this field to 'N'. Else, set it to 'Y'.
Used for internal purpose. Value of this field determines values of fields, 'RAC' and 'RSC'
This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.

H-YYYYMMDDHHMMSSsss - History. Where: YYYY - year, MM - month, DD - day, HH - hour, MM - minutes, SS - seconds and sss - miliseconds
The value is not editable by the user.

The value is not editable by the user.
